title: XING user
description:
There is a special user profile, the [empty user profile](https://dev.xing.com/docs/user_profile#empty-user-profile), that will be returned whenever the user doesn't exists.

Most fields are filled with values, but for some there is no value. Have a look at the [documentation](https://dev.xing.com/docs/user_profile#empty-user-profile) for details.

id.description: **Warning**: The user `id` will be `null`, when the [empty user profile](https://dev.xing.com/docs/user_profile#empty-user-profile) is returned.

display_name.description: The `display_name` consists of the `first_name`, `last_name` and an academic title (if present).

page_name.description: The `page_name` is `null` for the the [empty user profile](https://dev.xing.com/docs/user_profile#empty-user-profile).

active_email.description: You can only get this information for the current user. For all other users, the email address can be found under `/private_address/email` or `business_address/email`, if access was granted.

name.description: A list of valid time zones can be obtained from https://www.iana.org/time-zones

badges.description:
While `PREMIUM` refers to membership types, other badges refer to the user's status (`MODERATOR`, etc.)

Badges are only used for front-end purposes. A distinction between premium and basic is considered a bad practice: consumers should use the `premium_services` list for the specific information they want to check!

wants.description: This is a comma separated list.

haves.description: This is a comma separated list.

interests.description: This is a comma separated list.

organisation_member.description: This is a comma separated list.

languages.description: The list of languages can include the following abbreviations: `de`, `en`, `es`, `fi`, `fr`, `hu`, `it`, `ja`, `ko`, `nl`, `pl`, `pt`, `ru`, `sv`, `tr`, `zh`, `ro`, `no`, `cs`, `el`, `da`, `ar`, `he`.

primary_company.description: `primary_company` is always an object, even if the user does not have a primary company. All fields will be empty in that case.

non_primary_companies.description: This field is **deprecated**. Don't use it any more. Use `companies` instead. The `non_primary_companies` field will be removed in the future.

primary_school.description: When the user does not have a primary school, it will be `null`.
